Yii Framework v2.0.0-dev Class Reference

Class yii\log\FileTarget

All Classes | Properties | Methods
Inheritanceyii\log\FileTarget » yii\log\Target » yii\base\Component » yii\base\Object
Implementsyii\base\Arrayable
Available since version2.0
Source Code
FileTarget records log messages in a file.

The log file is specified via $logFile. If the size of the log file exceeds $maxFileSize (in kilo-bytes), a rotation will be performed, which renames the current log file by suffixing the file name with '.1'. All existing log files are moved backwards by one place, i.e., '.2' to '.3', '.1' to '.2', and so on. The property $maxLogFiles specifies how many files to keep.

Property Details

$logFile property
string $logFile = null

Log file path or path alias. If not set, it will use the "runtime/logs/app.log" file. The directory containing the log files will be automatically created if not existing.

$maxFileSize property
integer $maxFileSize = 10240

Maximum log file size, in kilo-bytes. Defaults to 10240, meaning 10MB.

$maxLogFiles property
integer $maxLogFiles = 5

Number of log files used for rotation. Defaults to 5.

$fileMode property
integer $fileMode = null

The permission to be set for newly created log files. This value will be used by PHP chmod() function. No umask will be applied. If not set, the permission will be determined by the current environment.

$dirMode property
integer $dirMode = 509

The permission to be set for newly created directories. This value will be used by PHP chmod() function. No umask will be applied. Defaults to 0775, meaning the directory is read-writable by owner and group, but read-only for other users.

$behaviors property read-only
yii\base\Behavior[] getBehaviors( )

list of behaviors attached to this component

$levels property
integer getLevels( )
void setLevels( $levels )

the message levels that this target is interested in. This is a bitmap of level values. Defaults to 0, meaning all available levels.

void init( )
